intro: Reidia, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to regions of eastern and central North America. The plants typically have dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produce clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. Reidia species are often found in moist, shaded woodlands and are valued for their ornamental appeal. They are also known for their toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals.
